inner col col24 first last id1f1a0337-0e22-462a-bfd3-836783266b03

h4.a: Mesquite to celebrate Hispanic Heritage Month

div.div: From Sept. 15 to Oct. 15, the City of Mesquite will celebrate Hispanic Heritage Month with special recognitions and a wide variety of events. Read on...

img.alt: Participants running from zombie at Guts and Gory Zombie Experience

h4.a: Escape the apocalypse at Guts & Gory Zombie Experience

div.div: Adventure-seekers are invited to take part in the Guts & Gory Zombie Experience from 9 a.m. to noon on Saturday, Sept. 28. Read on...

h4.a: City of Mesquite files lawsuit against Tradewind Apartments

div.div: After repeated attempts to obtain improved building conditions that meet code, the City of Mesquite commenced legal proceedings against the owner and operator of Tradewind Apartments. Read on...

img.alt: brown and black dog getting a belly rub

h4.a: Mesquite Animal Shelter to offer free pet adoptions on Sept. 7

div.div: The Mesquite Animal Shelter is once again participating in the national Clear the Shelters campaign with a special one-day event on Sept. 7, waiving all adoption fees. Read on...

img.alt: Code ambassador program social media graphic

div.div: Register now to be part of the Code Ambassadors program, a volunteer-based initiative created to assist code enforcement officers in keeping Mesquite clean and safe. Read on...

img.alt: Mesquite Fire Department Chief Russell &#34Rusty&#34 Wilson

h4.a: Wilson to retire as Fire Chief on Aug. 31

div.div: The City of Mesquite has announced that Russell “Rusty” Wilson will retire as Fire Chief on Aug. 31. Wilson has served in the position since November 2020. Read on...

img.alt: Mesquite Freedom Park - sign - Mesquite TX

h4.a: Mesquite to host Patriot Day memorial event on 9/11

div.div: The City of Mesquite will host a short Patriot Day memorial ceremony at 8:30 a.m. on Wednesday, Sept. 11, at Mesquite Freedom Park. Read on...
The regular trash collection schedule has resumed. To date,11,800 tons of brush has been collected. Read on...

img.alt: Drive Like Your Family Lives Here crossing guard

h4.a: As new school year starts, City urges safe driving

div.div: On Wednesday, Aug. 14, Mesquite police officers, firefighters, and members of the City Council helped welcome Mesquite ISD students back to school for the 2024-25 school year. Read on...

img.alt: Residents sit in lawn chairs watching a movie in the park on a large inflatable screen

h4.a: Join the family fun with Movies in the Park

div.div: Everyone is invited to enjoy an evening of family-friendly fun and entertainment at Movies in the Park from 7-10 p.m. on Saturday, Sept. 14, at Rorie-Galloway Day Camp. Read on...

img.alt: City of Mesquite and Dallas County officials celebrate the Skyline Drive project completion

div.div: The City of Mesquite and Dallas County officials recently celebrated the completion the reconstruction of Skyline Drive. Read on...
Storm debris cleanup is in the final stages. Crews continue to pick up in the south part of the City. To date,11,500 tons of brush has been collected. Read on...
